#Text=Tekla Bądarzewska-Baranowska
#Text=Grave of Tekla Bądarzewska-Baranowska in the Baranowski family tomb , Powązki Cemetery , Warsaw
#Text=Tekla Bądarzewska-Baranowska ( 1829/1834 – 29 September 1861 ) was a Polish composer .
#Text=Bądarzewska was born in 1829 in Mława [ 1 ] or 1834 in Warsaw . [ 2 ]
#Text=She married Jan Baranowski and they had five children in their nine years of marriage .
#Text=Bądarzewska-Baranowska died on 29 September 1861 in Warsaw .
#Text=Her grave in the Powązki Cemetery features a young woman with a roll of sheet music titled La prière d'une vierge .
#Text=One of her daughters , Bronisława , was enrolled at the Warsaw Institute of Music in 1875 . [ 3 ]
#Text=A crater on Venus is named after her .
#Text=In 2016 , she appeared as one half of a pop idol duo with Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky in an anime series , Classicaloid .
#Text=She was portrayed by Mao Ichimichi .
#Text=A Maiden 's Prayer
#Text=Main article : Maiden 's Prayer

#Text=Bądarzewska wrote about 35 small compositions for piano ; by far her most famous composition is the piece Modlitwa dziewicy , Op. 4 ( " A Maiden 's Prayer " , French : La prière d'une vierge ) , which was published in 1856 in Warsaw , and then as a supplement to the Revue et gazette musicale de Paris in 1859 .
#Text=Several musical scholars have spoken somewhat ill of Bądarzewska 's musical career .
#Text=Percy Scholes writes of Bądarzewska in The Oxford Companion to Music ( 9th edition , reprinted 1967 ) : " Born in Warsaw in 1838[ sic ] and died there in 1861 , aged twenty-three[ sic ] .
